title: Non-profit ICORE Initiative to Support and Develop Innovation in Open Access, Open Educational Practices and Resources, and more
segmentation: Welcome everybody.
My name is Kristen Stucker.
I will talk about Iko completely different topic right now, but I hope that I can attract a little bit of your interest and that you can stay until the coffee break is starting in a few minutes.
That's why I'd like to make it very short and brief.
You can get, of course all these slides after.
It's according to this wonderful Creative Commons license agreement.
Backgrounds on my person.

I'm with University of this book Essen in Germany, but I'm also with the Korean National Open University and the East China Normal University and I'm sharing some sensation committees in the fields of quality standards as well as E learning standards.
That's why I also appreciate it very much.
Your focus on future standards that are highly needed.

What we are doing is when we are doing a lot of things in four specific areas that are labeled their competence and skills modeling open education and research technology enhanced learning at large scale and quality management and evaluation including also impact measurement.
If you want to learn more about that, you can have a look on all these different links here.

I would like to talk about a challenge and the challenge is how to connect, open research and open education and that is one of the main outcomes from our research that I'm coordinating in my universities during the last 1015 years we had a lot of projects in the fields of open education, but also many in the fields of OP research and even in our universities we have not managed to.
Join them and to make mutual benefits from each other.
That's why we.
I believe we have to strengthen something here, but first of all I would have to tell the normal audience why we should do something like open research and open education for us.
That is under the umbrella of open learning because of research and open education as both to deal with open learning.
In a sense.
Well, I hope that you are already convinced here why we should do something like open learning.
That's why I like.
To skip the explanations that we have got a digital age and changing factors here globalizations that is take.
In place that we have internationalization leading to global challenges, but also options and the most important now.
New issue and challenges to learn to learn for jobs that are not yet existing, but coming up in 10 years.
What is the current situation?
The current situation already explained today in the more?
Thing by our Commissioner is that we have something.
That is, opening up education.
The new policy by the European Commission that is fitting and addressing the counter situation, at least in Europe.
But I think this is not that different from other parts of the world we have still.

Just the lack of the missing digital equipment on the one hand, but even more important, and that is that was highlighted several times today in the morning, we need to train the teachers to see the benefits of open education and open learning.
You can find the policy by the European Commission.
Down there and we have some initiatives that are taking place in open education.
I just want to introduce to you open discovery space.
There will be a presentation after the coffee break about open discovery space.
If you want to learn about that right now I have something here with me and I can just give it around and you can pick up.
I have more if they're running out.
Open Discovery Space is focusing on open education 2050.
Two partners in 28 countries with 10,000 teachers that are trained to introduce E learning in school education on the other.

And we have some initiatives and I'm just picking up one of many of them like wow, that is that was dealing of for Open Access and metadata for scientific research by federating and harvesting already existing online repositories to connect them, but.
How to connect.
Open education and open.
Right?
Kurt we believe this is what is currently needed to make that close linkage and connection between open education, open research and that is my key message and.
We want to see that something is taking place that we are labeling open, learning as an umbrella term for open research and open education to enable future learning for our chill.
Open learning means two different things.
I don't want to go into the details that you can find a reference for an article and that you can also find on the web.
It's also or of course we have to.
Combine open learning styles as well as open learning scenarios.
That is the short message here, but please ask me in the coffee break if you want to learn more about that.
That means our common goal is open learning as the long term objective of all our actions and activities that we're doing in our research, as well as implementation projects.
Again, let me write the challenges how to connect that and how.
Could you?
Do something here.
How could you contribute to that?
And to participate here?

After several years, as I already mentioned in the beginning, we have started to work on something that we are now calling iqua Currently I core is the abbreviation and acronym for International Council for Open Research and Open Education.

At the moment we are discussing if you should change that into international community or International Corporation for Open research and open Education and I will tell you in one minute why we're doing so.
This took place.
For the first time, the 15th of May last year in Rome.
Wonderful kickoff meeting of icon.

With the presence of many organizations including Open Courseware Consortium as well as several UNESCO chairs as well as other organizations like I, CDE, Eden and also regional and international organizations, you can find all the details about the meetings and all the minutes on the website what?
I'd like to thank this that I call is something for you.
Because I Co is nonprofit initiative.
It's a global initiative.
And it is a lightweight initiative.
After several talks during the last month, we decided we don't want to establish just another Association.
As we have already so many working and focusing on open education or on open research.
The real problem is.
None of our existing Association are doing both.
With the same balance, and also none of them is promoting these connections, these mutual benefits between connecting open research and open education.
For that reason, we would like and we have already started as a Corporation with existing associations.
We have skipped our idea to establish another Association, but we will be, let's say, the flash mob for connecting open research and open education online free membership.
That means nothing to pay, just to spend your time.
But I think, and I hope that it's worth the time.
We have online meetings.
We have a wiki for collaboration.
We have next ichor events.
One is taking place in two weeks.
I will just tell you more about that in a few seconds.
And we have defined our common goals and our common objectives.
It's a kick off meeting at the first face to face meeting in Rome.
We had a brainstorming session.
We have collected the input.
We have listed all the ideas and then we had the voting and the first 3.
The topics were voted at the kickoff meeting.

The 4th one came just during the last month of discussions and we want first of all to promote the connection between open research and open education in close cooperation with others or associations, you want to define key terms, not from the scratch.
There already alot of definitions that are existing, but some of them are competing.
That's why just to bring all.
Of them into our wiki to show how different views are evolving and hopefully also to make you aware that there is a need for a commonly shared understanding.
And I would say brilliant idea was that we should start working first of all on a guide for young researchers because young researchers are not only our future, but they have in particular questions.
What does it mean openness?
What does it mean?
Open education?
Open research for me.
And finally, would like also to address the openness and quality of Moocs.
The openness is.
Not that easy to answer as it looks like on the 1st view becausw you could of course.
Just simply register for some of most of the books, but what is happening then?
Do you know what is happening with you, what with your data?
You know what is happening when you have finished?
Everything sometimes it's not very clear from the beginning what is happening or how much you have to pay at the end.
For example, if you want to get something like a certificate or.
Anything OK, that's what we are talking about.
Out.
We see the need for cooperation.
We have already 200 fifth more than 250 members that joined I code during the last 12 months.
We have big interest by key stakeholders.
We are already recognized by the European Commission.
We were invited to some of their events.
We could also give a presentation at their consultation day about Open Access and open research data last year and we would like to.
Join forces with you because we believe what you are developing in open education.
Could be highly relevant in open research.
And open research could use the practices.
There was also the idea of the notion how to use open education as a testbed.
Of course, open education is the best testbed for exploring and assessing new ways.
Innovative scenarios by open research on the other way around.
If you look at open repositories built up by sector specific open researchers.
You cannot imagine how many open resources are existing worldwide on the web, but no one in the field of education is aware of if you point the teachers to some of these repositories.
They're telling you why haven't you showed me that before?
I'm looking for that for many years now.
In the afternoon there will be the presentation about open discovery space.
I will show you examples of repository's incredible.
You can click us, just go there for any subject you can imagine, and yeah.
That's why we're saying there is a need for cooperation and there is a huge potential for mutual mutual benefit between open research and open education.
OK, and how to participate?
OK, very easy, just in brief.
Of course you can also join icon.
We had already one face to face meeting.
We have had four online meetings since the kick of we have the icon Wiki where you can find everything you can just register and then you log in and you can change everything.
You can even delete everything.
But of course we are tracking and.
Doing also a saving of the versions.
That's why even if somebody is deleting everything, it's not lost and we have next ichor events at the Linc conference in two weeks, as well as at Eden Conference taking place in June in Zagreb.
And just to allow one word about the workshop, the Icon Workshop in two weeks in Crete at the Link 2014, it's a joint event together with UNESCO IIT from Moscow.
ICD open courseware and Creative Commons will also be represented by Ignasi Labastida, and this is an interactive session for open discussion up research and open education.
The hidden treasures and I hope that you have.
Already an idea what is meant by the hidden treasures.
That is what I was referring to.
The potential of the mutual benefits, well joins the debate.
It's.
I highly recommend that event, not only because we are organizing the event, but we had only positive feedback in the past.
This event was funded by the European Commission three years ago, but now it's not no funded anymore, it's just done by ourselves.
This year together with CEF.
This is from the last year where we.
Could also welcome the new director of DG Education and Culture, Antonio Savored Amanda's and in the headquarters of FAO.
And this year it's on Crete, 7th to 9th of May.
If you want to learn more about it, look at the website www.learning-innovations.
But EU and we hope this could also lead to your.
Participation in the I core event and the Icon Workshop at the Linc Conference.
All the results are, of course, available as open educational resources.
And this is concluding my presentation.
But before you are going into the coffee break, I just want to share with you one reminder that you're not forgetting what I'm talking about.
You can find 1st.
References of course here.
But
First of all.
I'd like to thank you very much for your attention and.
And looking forward to your question, thank you.
